body.name: ECHOGEAR MaxMotion TV Wall Mount for Large TVs Up to 90" - Full Motion Has Smooth Swivel, Tilt, & Extension - Universal Design Works with Samsung, Vizio & More - Includes Hardware & Drill Template
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 17 hrs 15 mins
features: Designed to accommodate almost any VESA pattern, this mount is compatible with all major TV brands including LG, Sony, Vizio, and Samsung.

Use the included drilling template & extensive hardware pack to get your TV on the wall in under 30 minutes. That'll give you plenty of time to catch up on House Of The Dragon before hitting the sack.
We never skip leg day. Our heavy-gauge steel supports TVs up to 90" or 125 lbs. 75" Samsung? No problem. 85" Vizio? Easy money.

Makes your TV position fully adjustable. Pull your TV out 22" away from the wall and point it anywhere in the room with 130º of smooth swivel. Retracts back 2.4" from the wall for the real slim shady look.
ECHOGEAR cares about the planet. We're planting a tree for every EGLF2 TV mount sold. Hit a snag with install? Our Minnesota-based product nerds are available 7 days a week to help out.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page Next page 1 Tom Said It Best 2 Breezy Install 3 Drill With Confidence

Check Out These Moves Point It Where You Want It Tilt and swivel the screen to point almost anywhere in the room. Get weird, watch your team hit into another double play from the deck. Pull It Out, Put It Back In Extend your TV almost 2 feet from the wall with this beast. Made to support big TVs while not sacrificing a low profile.

Get Your TV On The Wall In Under 30 Minutes We know you don't want to spend all day trying to mount your TV, and neither do we. That's why we simplified the process with a witty (and helpful) manual, drilling template, pre-sorted hardware, and a 3-step install process. Get ready to experience a DIY-friendly install with ECHOGEAR. Beer not included.

For The Readers Out There Wall mounting is the best way to get the most from your new large TV. Not only will it keep your investment safe, but will drastically enhance your viewing experience. You'd swear Pat Mahomes came over with all the winning you'll be doing once that 4k beauty is on the wall. So how will mounting your TV improve the viewing experience? So glad you asked. 1. Your screen will be at eye level If you set your TV on an entertainment center, the screen is often below the best viewing angle. By mounting, you can hang the TV in the sweet spot, with the middle of the screen lining up with your eye level. That gives you a better picture plus reduces fatigue during your Overwatch gaming marathons. Dibs on Zenyatta. 2. Point the TV almost anywhere This is the biggest benefit of full motion mounts. By extending from the wall, you have space to swivel the screen to point at any seat. Now you can get the perfect picture while sitting in that comfy recliner you found on the side of the road. Trust me, watching the Fast & Furious movies from your favorite spot enhances the enjoyment tenfold. Man, the Rock is so badass. If you're feeling wild, you could even point the TV to a different room, like the kitchen. That means catching up on The Last Of Us while pan-searing that delicious bass you caught. 3. Quick & easy install Sounds too good to be true? Long story short: It's not. Nope, Echogear knows your time is straight cash, homie! That's why we made sure we designed an awesome mount that was awesomely simple to install in just three easy steps: Attach wall plate to wall, connect brackets to TV, hang TV. That's it. Ok, maybe we've paraphrased a bit, but the included handy installation manual tells you everything you need to know. We hear it's fun to read, too. Either way, we think you're going to really dig this mount.

You Read That Right Want to help make the world just a little greener? Buy a mount from ECHOGEAR and we'll plant a tree on your behalf. So far we've planted over 500,000 trees! Made in MN ECHOGEAR was born and raised in Minnesota, and it shows. From the friendly install manual to the nice Minnesotans ready to help you, your project is as good as done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy duty for big TV's
reviews.reviewText: Excellent product for your larger wall mounted flat screen,, while you do need some tools to install, the install is straightforward and simple. Find your studs, drill , lag bolt it to wall and place TV on it after mounting the brackets to TV. The kit comes COMPLETE with all lag bolts for the wall, various bolts to mount the brackets to the TV including an assortment of spacers if needed. The directions are clear and easy to understand. The unit itself is ONE SINGLE PIECE, and it is ALL STEEL, so it does have a bit of weight to it ( about 20 or so pounds). No complaints here !!!! i just mounted a 70" 65 pound lg flatscreen to the wall,, its secure, moves easily in and away from wall and angles left right and you can adjust the forward tilt up and down,, there is also a very simple adjustment if your mounting bracket is a little off level to level the TV itself after placing on mount. Im very confident this product is never coming off the wall EVER until I take it off. Over all one hell of a good deal for a quality item, If you want to see how good they really are, go to the MFG website. I did my research on quite a few mounts and there no need to spend 2-300 or more when this one does the job just as good. I highly recommend this product !!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product, good installation instructions
reviews.reviewText: I always buy cheap TV mounts, but this time I didn't feel like dealing with bad quality. This TV mount is so nice, the instructions were clear (and even funny with some jokes a sprinkled in), and it's very smooth when you're adjusting the TV and the viewing angle. The hardware included is good quality and the whole mount is heavy in a good way.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Awesome TV Mount. Easy to install and very heavy duty. Best on the market!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Get this wall bracket
reviews.reviewText: I have mounted many T.V.s and this is the best wall bracket that I have seen. It has a smooth range of motion but it is tight so it stays where you put it. It even has handles to make it easier to move so you aren't grabbing the sides of your T.V.It is easy to mount and the mounting template works great.They give you all the hardware you will need including cord straps. You will have to supply the tools, but that is to be expected. You will need a power drill, drill bit, level, stud finder, hex socket, and some tape for mounting the template.Seriously, this is a great stand, just buy it already.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well built and strong TV wall hanger.
reviews.reviewText: The quality of this product is superb and the instructions are easy to follow. Since it is designed to fit almost any TV, it comes with enough spare parts to start your own hardware store.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very worthy mount. Only minor gripes.
reviews.reviewText: This is a very good TV mount. I used it for a 65in LG OLED C1 TV which weights around 75lbs.I had already owned a different full motion mount for my prior TV but given the required placement of the mount on that TV (much lower), I was going to have to move the old one anyway. The specs on that one suggested that it maxed out on a 60inch TV. I'm sure it would've worked but that other mount was somewhat tough to move when the TV was actually on it so I decided to get a new one. In comes the ECHOGEAR mount...Everything needed for mounting was included. Especially important are the lag bolts for the portion that mounts to the wall. I don't believe I received those with the prior mount so that's an extra cost (and trip) to factor in for other mounts. Also appreciated the template provided. Instructions were clear, well written and entertaining. I really don't know why that is so hard for many companies but they could take a cue from ECHOGEAR on how to write instructions.Overall, installing the mount was not difficult. The hardest part is just making sure you find studs in the wall and are relatively centered on them. And I guess holding the mount while installing the first couple of lag bolts. My installation has the TV located in a cutout over my fireplace -- i.e. a recessed nook. My TV is 57in wide, the cutout is about 59in wide so there isn't a lot of clearance on the sides. After mounting the brackets to the TV, I measured from the bracket hooks on the TV to the top and bottom of the TV to ensure I was placing it at the right height in the cutout. Marked the height in the nook, grabbed the template and marked where my lag bolts would go in. I pre-drilled the holes and then held up the mount while screwing in the lag bolts, making sure it was level along the way. After that, it's just a matter of extending the mount, setting the TV brackets on the front top of the mount and securing the bottom. As another reviewer stated, it's a good idea to tighten down the tilt mechanism prior to putting on the TV, it can always be adjusted later.Overall, this could probably be done in about 20 minutes but I probably took an hour just to measure multiple times and think thru what I was doing. As I said, I only had about an inch clearance on either side so I was worried that my slightly off-center studs were going to make it very difficult. Based on where the holes in the backplate are and where my studs were located, the mount was an inch closer on one side then the other, so I was still worried about being centered. Turns out, that was all for naught -- while it's good to be as centered as possible, there is sufficient lateral movement in the mount to get the TV centered even if the mount isn't.You might be asking, why only 4 stars? Well, I have a couple of small gripes. Some may be fair, some less so:1. This mount moves easily, even with a 75lb mounted. Much, much better then my last one. I wanted this feature but now that it's mounted, I'm not as convinced I do. I only need the movement when first mounting it to pull the TV out, connect everything and then push the TV back into the cutout. After that, I'd prefer it didn't move again until I replace it. WIth this mount, if you touch the TV, it will move -- no real force needed. Given my minimal clearance on the sides and the fact that my TV is a thin piece of glass, I have minor concerns that I'm going to bounce it into the walls when cleaning. Hard to blame the mount for being too fluid but it's a thing.2. The paper template is nice for marking your holes. My minor gripe there is that it's hard to hold a piece of paper against a wall, put a level on it and mark the spots for you lag bolts at the same time. Very minor complaint and there may be some trick to this that I'm missing but it would be lovely if some clever person came up with a solution to that -- like a thicker edge on the template.3. Another minor complaint that may be more on LG then ECHOGEAR -- which screw should I use to mount the brackets to the TV? ECHOGEAR provides several different sizes with different lengths and widths. Ideally, you want to use the longest one that will fit in your TV. The problem is, that if you use one that is too long, you break your TV. If you use one too short, your TV may dismount prematurely. This is probably on the TV manufacturer to provide since I'm sure it varies. But a note in the instructions would be nice on how best to determine this. I struggled with this longer then I should have. For me, I took a medium length M10 bolt, attempted to thread it slowly and gently into the TV to see if it would fit all the way. It did, so I went with that. Could I have used a longer one? Perhaps, but we'll never know.4. The last gripe is cost. My previous mount was about $50. This one was closer to $120. They are both equally heavy duty and built very similarly. This one has much more fluid motion so it's worth extra $$. But is it worth over double? Probably not. But given how much I spent on the TV, I'm not going to lose sleep over the cost of the mount but I feel like it would be a better value around $80 and that would have warranted a 5th star from me.In summary, I listed gripes but the reality is that there are many more features of this mount that are good and it's definitely something I would purchase again or recommend to a friend. However, I would also have them watch to see if they could get it a little cheaper than list price.
Se siente un producto de calidad, instrucciones claras (solo que vienen en inglés), cumple lo que ofrece.

We bought this to hang our 55" TV.We chose this model to fit the bolt pattern on our TV and after finishing the install, we are confident this is a good product. This appears to be well made and good quality.The mount is packaged very well, we had no concerns anything inside was damaged, and there is a great selection of screws and spacers. The lag bolts were good quality.The instructions are the best : clear, well written, good pictures, and they have some fun too.As the product claims, this is very easy to install. The template is accurate and makes this a quick job (once you find the centre of your studs). If you are unsure at all, watch the installation video - it's only a few minutes long and is a reliable demonstration of all the steps.The mount moves smoothly when pulled away from the wall and pushed back in.Great options for extending out from the wall, tilting down, changing viewing angle - all the product descriptions for range of motion are accurate and easy to adjust.

I’ve owned a lot wall mounts and this one is by far cheaper and a better product then any one I own. The installation instructions are easy to follow also the company adds little jokes in and the dad in me quite enjoyed that. Would definitely recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: LA MEJOR COMPRA QUE HE HECHO EN AMAZON
reviews.reviewText: Quede encantado con el producto, pocos dan tanta movilidad como este brazo a teles de tan grande tamaño

reviews.reviewTitle: Super Sturdy mount for my 65" TV
reviews.reviewText: I've had this mount installed for over a year now and have had zero problems. It has good range of motion and is well made. Installation was easy.If I ever need another mount, I'll be getting it from Echogear.
